name: Frank Lampard
short_description: Chelsea's all-time top scorer, legendary English midfielder.
extended_description: Frank Lampard was a goal-scoring midfielder crucial to Chelsea's dominance in the 2000s. He won multiple Premier League titles and a Champions League trophy.

name: Steven Gerrard
short_description: Iconic Liverpool captain and midfielder.
extended_description: Steven Gerrard is remembered for his loyalty to Liverpool, commanding midfield performances, and dramatic goals in crucial matches.

name: Ryan Giggs
short_description: Manchester United winger and Premier League legend.
extended_description: Ryan Giggs played his entire career at Manchester United, winning 13 Premier League titles and dazzling fans with his pace and dribbling.

name: Thierry Henry
short_description: Arsenal's all-time top scorer, French striker.
extended_description: Henry led Arsenal to multiple titles and the undefeated 'Invincibles' season with his speed, skill, and finishing ability.

name: Didier Drogba
short_description: Chelsea hero and clutch goalscorer from Ivory Coast.
extended_description: Drogba was famous for scoring important goals, especially leading Chelsea to Champions League glory in 2012.

name: John Terry
short_description: Chelsea's iconic captain and defender.
extended_description: Terry led Chelsea to numerous trophies with his leadership and defensive solidity over two decades.

name: Paul Scholes
short_description: Manchester United's midfield maestro.
extended_description: Scholes was famous for his passing, long-range shooting, and intelligence, winning multiple Premier League and Champions League titles.

name: Dennis Bergkamp
short_description: Elegant Dutch forward for Arsenal.
extended_description: Bergkamp was renowned for his technique, vision, and breathtaking goals, playing a key role in Arsenal’s most successful period.

name: Alan Shearer
short_description: Premier League's all-time top goalscorer.
extended_description: Shearer scored 260 Premier League goals, winning a title with Blackburn before becoming a Newcastle United legend.

name: Patrick Vieira
short_description: Dominant French midfielder and Arsenal captain.
extended_description: Vieira was the driving force behind Arsenal’s midfield, known for his strength, tackling, and leadership during their invincible season.

name: Wayne Rooney
short_description: Manchester United's all-time top scorer.
extended_description: Rooney combined skill, strength, and fierce competitiveness, helping United win multiple trophies including five Premier League titles.

name: Petr Čech
short_description: One of Premier League’s greatest goalkeepers.
extended_description: Čech was a vital part of Chelsea’s success in the 2000s, holding multiple clean sheet records in the league.

name: Ian Wright
short_description: Prolific Arsenal striker in the 90s.
extended_description: Wright’s goalscoring prowess helped Arsenal to domestic cup successes and laid foundations for later dominance.

name: Roy Keane
short_description: Hard-tackling Manchester United captain.
extended_description: Keane embodied Manchester United’s fighting spirit, captaining them through one of their most dominant eras under Sir Alex Ferguson.

name: Fernando Torres
short_description: Spanish striker who starred at Liverpool.
extended_description: Torres dazzled fans with his finishing and movement at Liverpool, before winning major trophies with Chelsea later.

name: Michael Owen
short_description: Liverpool wonderkid and Ballon d'Or winner.
extended_description: Owen burst onto the scene with blistering pace and clinical finishing, winning the Ballon d'Or in 2001.

name: Nemanja Vidić
short_description: Serbian rock at the heart of Manchester United's defense.
extended_description: Vidić was a no-nonsense defender known for his aerial ability and leadership, captaining Manchester United to multiple Premier League titles.

name: Cesc Fàbregas
short_description: Spanish playmaker for Arsenal and Chelsea.
extended_description: Fàbregas was known for his passing range, vision, and creativity, captaining Arsenal and later winning titles with Chelsea.

name: Ashley Cole
short_description: One of the best left-backs in Premier League history.
extended_description: Cole starred for both Arsenal and Chelsea, winning multiple league titles and being known for his defensive prowess and overlapping runs.

name: Jamie Carragher
short_description: Liverpool's defensive stalwart for over a decade.
extended_description: Carragher was a one-club man at Liverpool, known for his consistency, leadership, and commitment on the field.

name: Robin van Persie
short_description: Dutch striker who shined for Arsenal and Manchester United.
extended_description: Van Persie was a prolific goalscorer who won the Premier League Golden Boot and later led Manchester United to a title under Sir Alex Ferguson.

name: David Beckham
short_description: Global superstar and Manchester United winger.
extended_description: Beckham became world-famous for his pinpoint crossing, free kicks, and huge contributions to Manchester United's treble-winning season in 1999.

name: Robert Pirès
short_description: French winger and part of Arsenal's Invincibles.
extended_description: Pirès was known for his creativity and goal-scoring ability, playing a vital role in Arsenal's unbeaten 2003–04 season.

name: Gary Neville
short_description: Right-back and Manchester United captain.
extended_description: Neville was a consistent and reliable full-back who helped United to numerous trophies across his long career.

name: Claude Makélélé
short_description: French midfielder who defined the 'defensive midfielder' role.
extended_description: Makélélé was essential to Chelsea's rise in the mid-2000s, shielding the defense with incredible positioning and tackling.

name: Michael Essien
short_description: Powerful Ghanaian midfielder for Chelsea.
extended_description: Essien was renowned for his energy, defensive ability, and powerful shots, helping Chelsea win multiple trophies.

name: Teddy Sheringham
short_description: Veteran forward who starred for Tottenham and Manchester United.
extended_description: Sheringham was key to United's 1999 treble win, providing experience, goals, and intelligent link-up play.

name: Branislav Ivanović
short_description: Serbian defender and Chelsea fan favorite.
extended_description: Ivanović was known for his strength, aerial ability, and knack for scoring important goals, winning multiple trophies with Chelsea.

name: Freddie Ljungberg
short_description: Swedish winger and Arsenal Invincible.
extended_description: Ljungberg was known for his energetic runs, important goals, and crucial role in Arsenal's success under Arsène Wenger.

name: Edwin van der Sar
short_description: Dutch goalkeeper and Manchester United wall.
extended_description: Van der Sar was key to United's success in the late 2000s, winning multiple league titles and a Champions League title in 2008.
